job_description: The Vancouver Airport Authority is a community-based, not-for-profit organization that manages Vancouver International Airport (YVR).  As Canada’s second busiest airport, YVR served 17 million passengers in 2013. As one of BC’s top employers for the eighth year in a row, we are committed to creating an airport that British Columbia can be proud of: a premier global gateway, local economic generator and community contributor.Vancouver International Airport Authority’s success in making YVR one of the world’s top-rated airports is driven by the strengths of our people.Co-op Students – Engineering Projects Department – May to December 2015The Vancouver Airport Authority has an opportunity for four Engineering Co-op Students in the Engineering Projects Department.  The successful candidates will be working as part of a project team, planning and administering construction projects for the terminal building.Key responsibilities may include:• Assisting senior personnel with project and contract administration• Performing feasibility studies• Undertaking site inspections and recording findings• Meeting with various stakeholders• Managing micro-projects from initiation through to project close out
job_requirements: Key qualifications:The individual will have the following:• Civil, Electrical, or Mechanical engineering student registered with a co-op program• Ability to multitask and manage deadlines• Ability to learn quickly in order to read and understand construction drawings• Effective interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written)• Ability to work independently• Note that the successful candidates must be able to qualify for a Restricted Area Identity Card and a Transportation Security Clearance; as such, you must be able to provide a place of residence in Canada (if in Canada for less than 5 years, former addresses will be required) and have a clean criminal recordWe are committed to employment equity and welcome applications from everyone, including women, aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities.Reference #: 15-ENGCOOP1Application deadline:To apply: Please submit a cover letter and resume, quoting “Ref #: 15-ENGCOOP1” Open To All Majors:No
